title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Physical Therapist Assistants

content.rendered:
What is a Physical Therapist Assistant?

Physical Therapist Assistants help Physical Therapists execute treatment programs for patients. Their tasks can range from observing patients, helping patients do exercise, or other forms of treatment with the goal of helping the patients get better.

Where does a Physical Therapist Assistant work?

  • Physical therapy clinics
  • Nursing homes
  • Sports and fitness facilities

How much does a Physical Therapist Assistant make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Physical Therapist Assistant is $51,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Physical Therapist Assistants?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Kinesiology majors
  • Biology majors
  • Physiology majors
Search Physical Therapist Assistant jobs

Physical Therapist Assistant skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Physical Therapist Assistants succeed in their work:

  • Strong communication skills
  • Detail oriented
  • Compassion for your patients

What are some common questions about Physical Therapist Assistants?

Q: How long is school for a Physical Therapist Assistant?

A: In most states, these programs take about 2 years to complete.

excerpt.rendered: Learn about the average salary, relevant studies, and common path after college to becoming a Physical Therapist Assistant.
